FuncDef:
The clock command configures a clock mode for an IMA-group interface.
The undo clock command restores the default clock mode.
By default, IMA-group interfaces work in CTC mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures an IMA-group interface to work in ITC mode.
-

Configures an IMA-group interface to work in CTC mode.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If two devices are directly connected using IMA-group interfaces, run the
clock command to configure a clock mode for each IMA-group interface so that the two devices can communicate. An IMA-group interface can work in either of the following clock modes:
CTC mode: All member links of an IMA group share the same clock source, which is either an external clock or the clock of a member link.ITC mode: Member links of an IMA group use different clock sources.
Configuring the IMA-group interfaces of the two directly connected devices to work in the same clock mode is recommended.

Prerequisites
An IMA-group interface has been created.
